body.name: Outlaw on the Ranch: A Historical Western Adventure Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Caleb returned from the war to find his family and the town in a war with outlaws. They are targeting the ranchers. He has trouble of the road and the ex sheriff and his daughter save him. They decided to work together to restore the town and ranchers to peace. But can they? I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A classic Western tale of Good vs Evil
reviews.reviewText: This is the story of a man, Caleb Diablo returning from the War Between the States, hoping to settle on his parents’ Texas Ranch, put down roots, and live peacefully. However, that is not to be as immediate, the stage he is riding home on is robbed and his best friend murdered. He finds out that the outlaw gang that killed his friend is terrorizing the ranches in his town, forcing people off their land and he pledges to bring them to justice. Along the way, he meets Rich Bowen and his daughter Sammie. He is a former sheriff and she is a crack shot and they have been hunting this gang of outlaws. Caleb teams up with Rich and Sammie and begins their quest to bring down the Jackson gang. Readers of Ethan Westfield have come to expect some familiar traits: a very well-written story about good vs evil and greed, lots of great action and adventure, with a small dose of romance and he delivers magnificently. Like most of his books, the story is long with a few plot twists but flows quite well and is really easy to read. I enjoyed reading this novel and I think you will too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good clean story.
reviews.reviewText: Caleb thought coming home from the war would give him the peace and quiet he had wanted for the last two years, but instead he found a bigger war at home attacking his parents and their neighbors farms. Sammie and her father had been chasing the outlaw Jackson and became friends with Caleb and his parents. The problem they faced together was the lack of success of the town's sheriff and mayor in putting an end of Jackson's terror in the community. Everything Caleb and Sammie's families tried to do only seemed to increase the terror of the Jackson gang. It all seemed hopeless, until secrets came to light.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good but mistakes
reviews.reviewText: This is really a great story, worth 4 or 5 stars. But little things, such as saying she instead of he and vice-versa, or shook her head instead of nodded. Irritating to me, and shouldn't be allowed to sneak through. The final blow was in the Extended Epilog, where the ranch house was spoken of as being his childhood home, when, in fact, the childhood ranch house burned to the ground at the end of the story, and a new one was built.These Extended Epilogs almost ALWAYS have errors in them that irritate me into not wanting to read them.... and I wish I had not this time. Sorry. Proof and edit! Please!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Caleb returns home from the Civil War finding the town to be controlled by a crooked Mayor!
reviews.reviewText: This fascinatingly five star extravaganza will definitely keep you turning pages to see what the next exciting encounter might be just around the corner! This is a fast moving series of ongoing excitement that will pacify anyone's desired expectations!Some of the most entertaining storylines I have had the opportunity to follow, as the good guys fight the unknown from beginning to end! Too, the Author's superbly selection of characters will pacify anyone's desired reading expectations from beginning to end!Most definitely recommend this fast moving series of unending adventures to all readers, regardless of what your desired reading experiences might be! No slowdowns from beginning to end!!!😃

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved it all. Lots of action.I was real glad when to see that they were going to be able to have their house and get the cows replaced.The mayor being the head of the bad guys was a surprise.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not up to par with most Westerns
reviews.reviewText: Calab, war vet can't hit an out law when gets the outlaws gun??? Doesn't even have a gun when stopped by two outlaws?? Story boring and not beleaveable . stopped reading after way less than third way to the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not very good
reviews.reviewText: Poor writing not a good idea that we live with, not close to being realistic like ha to use twenty word to say how bad it is

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Story seems to written by someone very nieve, like 13 Yr old girl, at times almost unbelievable. Characters actions are not consistent in their responses to events. It does not seem believable at times.

reviews.reviewTitle: Are "good" proofreaders hard to come by?
reviews.reviewText: The story was itself was good and reasonably well to follow. The characters had depth to them. Quite an enjoyable book, but I just don't understand why there's so many grammatical errors. They introduced a man named Major Chesterton and the next thing he was being called Sheriff Chesterton. Misspelled words throughout the book. I've read three books in the last week and they are all the same, filled with the same kind of grammatical errors. They can throw the readers off!!!

Caleb Diablo returns from war to his hometown; on the stagecoach, he witnesses a murder. He wants revenge for his friend. His parents are having trouble on the ranch, as her many around the town. Sammie Bowen learned to shoot a gun from her father, a retired sheriff. They come to the rescue of Caleb when he needs it most. They then work together to solve what is happening in their town.
